citations.narrative:
The facility lost one Rose-breasted Grosbeak due to suspected predation within its primary enclosure. On October 24th,
2024, the husbandry staff were unable to locate one grosbeak housed in an aviary. While the staff was able to locate the
other two grosbeaks housed within the same habitat, the third grosbeak was never found, and considered deceased by
October 28th, 2024. The staff discovered feathers present within the aviary, and later identified burrowing holes under the
ground of the exhibit, suspecting a rodent as the cause of predation event.
Ongoing threats due to predation are a concern for all birds housed in their respective enclosures, as these opportunities
contribute to unnecessary stress, injuries, fear, and occurrences of trauma for all birds on-hand. The facility must ensure
that bird enclosures are maintained in good repair, protect the birds from injury, contain the birds, and restrict other
animals from entering that may negatively affect the welfare of the birds within.
Corrective actions were promptly taken by the facility following this occurrence.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.150(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
The facility lost one Rose-breasted Grosbeak due to suspected predation within its primary enclosure. On October 24th, 
2024, the husbandry staff were unable to locate one grosbeak housed in an aviary. While the staff was able to locate the 
other two grosbeaks housed within the same habitat, the third grosbeak was never found, and considered deceased by 
October 28th, 2024. The staff discovered feathers present within the aviary, and later identified burrowing holes under the 
ground of the exhibit, suspecting a rodent as the cause of predation event. 
 
Ongoing threats due to predation are a concern for all birds housed in their respective enclosures, as these opportunities 
contribute to unnecessary stress, injuries, fear, and occurrences of trauma for all birds on-hand. The facility must ensure 
that bird enclosures are maintained in good repair, protect the birds from injury, contain the birds, and restrict other 
animals from entering that may negatively affect the welfare of the birds within.  
 
Corrective actions were promptly taken by the facility following this occurrence. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
